txt.en: 'Pay no heed to those others, focus on the Longbeard!'
'For every Dourhand you kill, I will kill ten Longbeards!'
'You have gained entry through some dishonourable means, Gimli, son of Glóin.'
'So be it. If you won't come down, Skorgrím, we'll come up!'

'You fought well, [placeholder], and we have put an end to Skorgrím's menace! I am troubled by the escape of the Nazgûl and the apparition that appeared upon Skorgrím's death, but there is nothing we can do about that right now. At least we have paid the Dourhands for their treachery! Ha ha!'
'It was a good battle, but I think it is time to leave. I am ready to journey back to the guest rooms at Rivendell when you are.'

'Skorgrím must think that the walls of his fortress will keep him safe, tall and broad as they are, but he does not know about the key-stone you recovered.

'We will fight our way through his remaining defences, and perhaps I will give him one chance to come out of the main gates of the keep to face me in combat. He has no honour, so my challenge will probably go unanswered. It is just as well, but my axe is anxious for the chance to end this fool Dourhand!

'Are you ready? The Dourhands cannot hope to stand against us!'
'I am ready to go on, if you are as well. I will challenge Skorgrím to come down, and if he does not, we will seek out the hidden door.'
'What? How did you get in here?'

'It seems these Dourhands were not expecting us to come in by the hidden door, [placeholder].\n\n'This is amusing, but I tire of dealing with lesser Dourhands. Let us find Skorgrím with no further delay!'
'Skorgrím has nowhere left to hide, [placeholder], and I think he now realizes it. His doom stands outside his door, and he has no choice but to face it!\n\n'Are you ready for battle?'
'I am hurt! Where are my worthless guards?'
'This vessel has served our purposes well, but now its time is past.'
'Yes, I am close now. Very close to my objective.'

With your help, Glóin was able to obtain the key-stone to the secret entrance leading to the inner keep of the dwarf fortress located in the pass of Gabilazan. Alongside his son, Gimli, he has asked you to go into this keep and put a stop to the Nazgûl and Skogrím.
'It's time we finished this. The Nazgûl and Skorgrím have nowhere else to hide!'
'There's no need for haste! We can finish them handily!'
'You are a fool, Gimli, son of Glóin! You cannot hope to pass these strong walls!'
'Come out, you villains! Your day is done!'
'Enough talk, Skorgrím! My axe will put an end to your wagging tongue!'

Speak with Gimli to begin your foray into the dwarf-keep.\n\nThe dwarf-keep in the pass of Gabilazan might be both the last hiding-place of the Dourhands led by Skorgrím and the Nazgûl you have pursued through the Trollshaws and into the Misty Mountains.

Speak with Gimli to continue your foray into the dwarf-keep.\n\nThe dwarf-keep in the pass of Gabilazan might be both the last hiding-place of the Dourhands led by Skorgrím and the Nazgûl you have pursued through the Trollshaws and into the Misty Mountains.

Speak with Gimli to continue your foray into the dwarf-keep.\n\nThe dwarf-keep in the pass of Gabilazan might be both the last hiding-place of the Dourhands led by Skorgrím and the Nazgûl you have pursued through the Trollshaws and into the Misty Mountains.

You have made your way deep into the dwarf-keep. It is nearly time to confront the Nazgûl and Skorgrím. Speak with Gimli to begin the final battle.\n\nThe dwarf-keep in the pass of Gabilazan might be both the last hiding-place of the Dourhands led by Skorgrím and the Nazgûl you have pursued through the Trollshaws and into the Misty Mountains.
Gimli is standing in the courtyard of the keep of Gabilazan.\n\nYou have successfully defeated Skorgrím Dourhand, but the significance of his death is still uncertain.
'Get over here, you worthless giants! What is my master paying you for, if not for this?'
'Let us see now what Skorgrím has to say.'
'You shame the Longbeards with your sneaking and your crawling! Begone!'
'You are a fool. Where are your armies, stupid Longbeard?'
'You may wound this body, but this body is nothing to me!'
